messages.text: PTAL. On 2012/03/21 16:12:54, gri wrote: http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063/diff/7001/doc/effective_go.html#newcode774 > doc/effective_go.html:774: The signature of (*File).Write in > package os is: > I would write this as File.Write since methods are bound to the > receiver's base type (which is File, not *File). Done.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

LGTM

Please also fix the sentence below - I missed that one in the first round. Thanks.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063/diff/7002/doc/effective_go.html
File doc/effective_go.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063/diff/7002/doc/effective_go.html#newcode1332
doc/effective_go.html:1332: because equality is not defined on it.
s/it/them/

PTAL.

I also changed a few "in parallel" to "concurrently", because
I think it is not correct to use "in parallel" as it might not run
in parallel if GOMAXPROCS == 1.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=509fce3ba4e1 ***

doc/effective_go: minor corrections

R=golang-dev, gri
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063

Committer: Robert Griesemer <gri@golang.org>

http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063/diff/7001/doc/effective_go.html File doc/effective_go.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063/diff/7001/doc/effective_go.html#newcode774 doc/effective_go.html:774: The signature of (*File).Write in package os is: I would write this as File.Write since methods are bound to the receiver's base type (which is File, not *File).

http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063/diff/5004/doc/effective_go.html File doc/effective_go.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5848063/diff/5004/doc/effective_go.html#newcode2707 doc/effective_go.html:2707: errors and extract details. For PathErrors please undo this change. it looks weird. there is no need to switch fonts mid word. i don't have a working setup at the moment so i can't do this myself.
